Description: A hollow terracotta model of a sword hilt, with a ribbed grip and pointed-oval pommel. Modelled on both sides, the front more emphatic than the back, and complete in itself: there is no blade. Two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt. Traces of a white dressing survive on one edge.A hollow terracotta model of a sword hilt, with a ribbed grip and pointed-oval pommel. Modelled on both sides, the front more emphatic than the back, and complete in itself: there is no blade. Two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt. Traces of a white dressing survive on one edge.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. Roman, probably within the first three centuries AD. Comparanda. See those of registration no. 1870,0709.52.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3296)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
